data.title: One Word Story
data.statement:
Friend A and Friend B are playing the One Word Story game.

The goal is to create a coherent story, but each player can only add one word to the story at a time. The two friends will take turns adding words, <<Friend A will always start first>>.

Given Friend A's words and Friend B's words, output the story created.

testCases.title: A Long Time Ago
testCases.testIn:
5
5
A time in galaxy far
long ago a far, away...
testCases.testOut: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away...

testCases.title: One Sentence
testCases.testIn:
3
3
This a punctuated
is simple, sentence.
testCases.testOut: This is a simple, punctuated sentence.

testCases.title: Call a Bondulance
testCases.testIn:
7
7
The Name. Name. Name's james. Nond's a
bond's James Bond the Bames having stronk.
testCases.testOut: The bond's Name. James Name. Bond Name's the james. Bames Nond's having a stronk.

testCases.title: Several Sentences
testCases.testIn:
8
7
The Bond. Bond. Bond's name. Bond's having stronk.
name's James James the James not a
testCases.testOut: The name's Bond. James Bond. James Bond's the name. James Bond's not having a stronk.

testCases.title: Darling, Hold My Hand
testCases.testIn:
7
6
Nothing a and now, can $50 person.
beats Walk2holiday right you save per
testCases.testOut: Nothing beats a Walk2holiday and right now, you can save $50 per person.

testCases.title: Digits Part of Words
testCases.testIn:
7
6
N0th1ng 4 4nd n0w, c4n $50 p3rs0n.
b34ts W4lk2h0l1d4y r1ght y0u s4v3 p3r
testCases.testOut: N0th1ng b34ts 4 W4lk2h0l1d4y 4nd r1ght n0w, y0u c4n s4v3 $50 p3r p3rs0n.

testCases.title: 999 Bugs
testCases.testIn:
10
9
999 in code, bugs. 1 and it 1009 in code.
bugs the 999 Take down patch around, bugs the
testCases.testOut: 999 bugs in the code, 999 bugs. Take 1 down and patch it around, 1009 bugs in the code.

testCases.title: Larger Numbers
testCases.testIn:
10
9
809 in code, bugs. 1 and it 1006 in code.
bugs the 809 Take down patch around, bugs the
testCases.testOut: 809 bugs in the code, 809 bugs. Take 1 down and patch it around, 1006 bugs in the code.

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[words_B]] ≤ [[words_A]] ≤ [[words_B]] + 1

1 ≤ number of characters of each word in [[friend_A]] and [[friend_B]] ≤ 15

A word contains uppercase and/or lowercase English letters, and other non-space characters.
Spaces will never be considered part of a word, but will always be used to separate words in the strings instead.
data.stubGenerator:
read wordsA:int
read wordsB:int
loopline wordsA friendA:word(15)
loopline wordsB friendB:word(15)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The integer [[words_A]] specifying the number of words in [[friend_A]].
<<Line 2:>> The integer [[words_B]] specifying the number of words in [[friend_B]].

<<Line 3:>> The space-separated string [[friend_A]] containing <<all>> the words said by Friend A across the entire game.
<<Line 4:>> The space-separated string [[friend_B]] containing <<all>> the words said by Friend B across the entire game.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The string created by alternating the words of Friend A and Friend B, separated by a space.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Friend A and Friend B are playing the One Word Story game.

The goal is to create a coherent story, but each player can only add one word to the story at a time. The two friends will take turns adding words, Friend A will always start first.

Given Friend A's words and Friend B's words, output the story created.
Input
Line 1: The integer words_A specifying the number of words in friend_A.
Line 2: The integer words_B specifying the number of words in friend_B.

Line 3: The space-separated string friend_A containing all the words said by Friend A across the entire game.
Line 4: The space-separated string friend_B containing all the words said by Friend B across the entire game.
Output
Line 1: The string created by alternating the words of Friend A and Friend B, separated by a space.
Constraints
1 ≤ words_B ≤ words_A ≤ words_B + 1

1 ≤ number of characters of each word in friend_A and friend_B ≤ 15

A word contains uppercase and/or lowercase English letters, and other non-space characters.
Spaces will never be considered part of a word, but will always be used to separate words in the strings instead.
Example
Input
1
1
Hello,
World!
Output
Hello, World!
